message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CE, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.PL 

Reasoning: 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper discusses the use of computational Grids to enable more efficient use of existing experimental facilities, which involves distributed computing. 
- cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper focuses on the application of computational Grids to advance scientific understanding and innovation in magnetic fusion research. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper introduces the concept of "network services" that build on top of computational Grids, which requires the development of new authorization and enforcement capabilities. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper discusses the development of new authorization and enforcement capabilities to support the use of computational Grids in the Fusion community. 
- cs.PL (Programming Languages): The paper mentions the development and maintenance of Fusion codes, which may involve programming languages.
